page.title: 01LANDSCAPE HALWELL MORELEIGH
page.content: A gently rolling countryside,the rich dark soil rising in places to 230m, with a mild damp climate,it is ideal for producing lush grass to feed Fresian cattle, both beef and milk,and sheep for meat and wool. The land is divided by stone walls,narrow roads,ancient green lanes sunk below high hedges,many small streams and natural springs. 7km from the sea,10km from Dartmoor and 400km from London with a motorway link at Exeter and train service at Totnes the outside world impinges little here, being felt mainly in the increasing traffic through the two small villages. Some 260 inhabitants residing mainly along the main roads live largely from agriculture and its spinoffs,but the influx of retirees and rise in commuting increasingly counteracts this.
